item.title: An Attentive Recurrent Model for Incremental Prediction of Sentence-final Verbs
item.description:
Main idea

“Yu M. et al. (2016), phenotype is translated from genotype based on gene ontology, and predicted interaction scores may be influenced by errors in gene annotations or relationship between terms. As deep learning being effective in identifying complex patterns from feature-rich datasets, especially as recurrent neural networks(RNNs) such as long short term memory(LSTM) and gated recurrent unit(GRU) are capable of dealing with long-distance sequential data, predicting genetic interactions directly from DNA or amino-acid sequences using deep learning techniques would help us gain insights into underlying complex phenotypes.”

Click the Cite button above to demo the feature to enable visitors to import publication metadata into their reference management software.

Create your slides in Markdown - click the Slides button to check out the example.

Supplementary notes can be added here, including code, math, and images.
